title: Hungarian algorithm to optimize sirna prediction
description: Because we know that each plate contains 277 distinct classes, we can boost our predictions by solving the Assignment Problem. This approach can also be combined with predicting which group a plate belongs to (see https://www.kaggle.com/zaharch/keras-model-boosted-with-plates-leak), to narrow the 1108 classes to exactly 277. However, this is left out for simplicity. Uses the Hungarian algorithm to boost results from https://www.kaggle.com/chandyalex/recursion-cellular-keras-densenet (which scores 0.113), and acheives a + 0.016 boost over the baseline.
